intro: Geonoma stricta subsp. quibdoensis, commonly known as the Quibdo bamboo palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia. This plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and pinnately compound leaves that are often used in horticulture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appearance. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and growth habit compared to other members of the Geonoma genus.
